description: In a lecture hall setting, a human figure presents the classic 'chicken or the egg' paradox to an audience composed entirely of anthropomorphic chickens and roosters, creating an absurd juxtaposition. A screen behind the speaker displays images of a chicken on a nest, symbolizing the egg, and a human baby, adding a surreal non-sequitur to the origin question. The irony lies in the very subjects of the philosophical dilemma being asked to solve it. The chickens appear engaged, looking up attentively at the speaker and the screen. This surreal scenario underscores the inherent circularity and perhaps futility of definitively answering the ancient question.
caption: “Now here’s one of the mysteries of the universe. ... Which came first?”
